chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Semaj S. Blakey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Semaj S. Blakey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Semaj S. Blakey was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
* Pay DNA sucharge.
* Pay restitution plus surcharges  May Not have contact with gangs, members, or affiliations.  Must pay costs of legal representation.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  Consecutve to 14-CF-287.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++ Costs and Restitution still due and owing.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Consecutive to 14-CF-287.

records.addlTxt: Fr: clerk re: DE's request. Per Judge Meier, no credit due. Sentences were consecutive, not concurrent.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Bill Michel.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  838 -   Victim rights compliance. Court has reviewed ROAW and transcript of SEH. Sentencing recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 6 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision - consecutive to 14CF287.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered. Appeal Rights given.
Court reporter transcript invoice for 3/2/16 sentencing paid by county $24.00 per order of the court.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Bill Michel.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  333 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved. DE enters plea as to Ct1 of guilty - found guilty by the court. Ct2 dismissed and read-in. Ct3 dismissed outright. PSI waived. Sentence recommendations made. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions. 76 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered. Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $250 DNA surcharge and notice was given. Restitution in the amount of $3953.89 stipulated and ordered.  Appeal rights, voters rights, firearms warning given. Notice of dispo given to deputy.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE's appearance waived. DE appears by Atty Bill Michel.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1123 -   Victim rights compliance. FPT rescheduled.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
